website_summaries.verdict: This Schwinn has some solid features that live up to the brand's reputation.
pros: This is a reasonably priced bike by a name that's known in the industry for beginner-level bikes
It offers 21 speeds and 27.5-inch wheels, ideal for spending time exploring rough trails
cons: A few chain and brake issues have been reported
Difficult assembly is best left to a professional

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height and good quality...
customer_reviews.text: First impressions: It is easy to assemble, the breaks are very nice and the body of the bycicle has a good quality overall. I'm 5'3" woman, my weight is around 153 lbs and my inseam is 30", this size is perfect for me. I think these measurements might help someone, because I had to go through a lot of comments to get an idea if this bike had the height that suited me better. It is heavier than I was expecting, but I can lift it without too much effort. I will probably change the seat because I would like one that feels more cushioned. I will be updating this review...
customer_reviews.author: Ana Eleonor

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth The Money Saved
customer_reviews.text: The 29" wheels just mean that your feet will hit them every time you try to turn at 'low' speeds. The bike frame is not large enough to accommodate getting the seat high enough for my 6'3" body. At the highest possible extension the seat is still too low. It seems like a sturdy enough bike, but it is NOT fitted for a big person. I suggest going to your local bike shop and talking with the professionals... the amount of money your will save here is just a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was my christmas gift to myself. My 16 years old daughter decided she was going to put it together for me. Which she was able to do, it took her a little longer than it should've. Just because she didn't read the instructions. Pretty easy to put together. Love the bike, the height, the ride. I did order another seat as the one it comes with it's not comfortable. Not for long rides. Highly recommend it. Got a discounted one, from a party seller, like new. It looked like new, came with all original packaging and wrapping.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle

customer_reviews.title: When I opened the box and it was preassembled I ...
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box and it was preassembled I was thrilled Only minimum assembly add pedals, handlebar and seat. Brakes were set so installing the front tire was a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Pat Abercrombie

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, my wife loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife, she loves this bike. She's 5' 7" and about 136 lbs give or take. This bike fits her perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Mayne

customer_reviews.title: It has a good front fork with shocks
customer_reviews.text: This bike will keep you pedaling with 21 shift gears. It has a good front fork with shocks, which do help when crossing concrete / bumpy dirt roads. It sits comfortable when mounted and is easy to get on or off, and straddle when stopped. You have plenty of mounting area for a rear rack, and if needed a front rack also. Schwinn did a good job on this one!
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo P.

customer_reviews.title: High Timber 29"
customer_reviews.text: received this bike a week ago. Have been riding 5-10 miles a day, rides nice, shifts gears easily, just had to do some minor adjustments to suit me, haven't ridden a bike in over 15 years, seat is ok for me may want to change for more cushion, all in your preference, I'm 6'5" 215lbs. Bike fits me perfectly. A definite recommendation
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Take it to a bike shop.
customer_reviews.text: Great looking bike but unless you know how to adjust the brakes and know how to true the tire, your better off taking it to your local bike shop and have them tune the bike which I did. Cost me extra 70 dollars but well worth it. The bike works great now and I know it's safe to ride.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: Pros Well built and economical. Cons: Seat was designed to fit a 12 year old. I had to buy a larger seat that had cushion. The front wheel had a quick release that I didn't trust so I removed it and had the front wheel rebuilt to remove the quick release. I also bought inner tubes to hold up against a male rider. The two tubes were rated for 35psi. I bought new tubes for 85 psi, now the bike doesnt look flat as I ride. The tire tread is plastic not rubber. So I replaced that as well.
customer_reviews.author: TrojanChica

customer_reviews.title: Warehouse deal Not as described. :(
customer_reviews.text: Bought as warehouse deal. Sold as like new but when arrived it was missing parts and a break pad was actually broken. Was able to return it but the description should be far more accurate. It was in no way a complete and usable bike
customer_reviews.author: Erik DM

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike in January and finally my son had grown into it so I had a bike shop make sure it was put together properly. This bike is garbage. I don’t know how the handlebars the stem that goes into the bicycle broke off and the gears were starting to grind and make noise. I bought this bike because it was Schwinn and that’s what I grew up on. But this bike is garbage with cheap parts and what a shame this bike company has gone downhill so much.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great bike. Poor customer support.
customer_reviews.text: The bike would be great if the front wheel bearing wasn't defective. I'm sure it'll be great once fixed. Bought this bike for a charity event but needed to donate an actual functioning bike. So I bought a different Schwinn from another company. I asked to return this as I have no need for a defective bike now. I was told I would have to pay a fee to return it. I could understand the fee if I bought the wrong size bike or didn't want it anymore but consumers should not be inconvenienced twice in one transaction.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: got the 24 inch for my daughter ( only size available). claims to be an adult bike. She is 11 and 5'4" . bike is way too a small, and her knees hit the handle bars. And of course, the height of the handle bars cannot be adjusted. Now i have to take apart, re box and return. Just a warning for anyone else looking to buy this bike. if you are 5 feet tall it will prob be ok, otherwise dont buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great bike after some adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Got the bike. Took it out of the box with many problems: front and back breaks were not working. The handlebars kept going out of alignment. And chain kept going out. I had to do a few adjustments but after everything we got a great bike. If you are not very good with tinkering, I advice you take it to a bike shop. It would still be very affordable bike.
customer_reviews.author: pinecone

customer_reviews.title: Replacing a bike that died.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in fine condition. Was not terribly hard to put together... though I've had some issues fine tuning the brakes (they rub a bit). After about 10 miles or so, my hands/fingers start to get numb. Not sure if is the handle bar or not. I don't recall this issue with my old bike. I've also had some issues with the pedals hitting the ground when I turn around sharply. I've had to remain more upright. Overall this has been a good bike. It rolls well, brakes well, and satisfies my needs.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Oas

customer_reviews.title: Wheels/spokes flawed
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Schwinn bike we've ordered. The first kept getting flat tires even though it was only ridden on paved paths. Amazon was great about replacing the bike but unfortunately the same thing is happening with the replacement. We've used tire liners, extra thick tubes, extra thick tires but can't use it more than one day without getting a flat. We love the frame, suspension etc but it's useless with flat tires. Unfortunately it's too late to send the 2nd bike back. Our theory is that the spokes are poking the tires even though we couldn't feel them when changing the tubes. Very disappointed in Schwinn.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!! Very impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not the one to comment however this is a Very good bike!!!!Very sturdy and steel frame give very smooth ride. I’m 6ft 2in 265 and this bike holds me with ease so far. The seller very attentive In responding To your issues. To no fault of the seller or Fedex ground, but please beware of FedEx ground “ellenwood ga facility”. Had my bike for additional 7 days!! I had to pick the bike up myself which was absolutely fine with me. Fortunately I lived less than 20 miles away. However very good bike!!! Easy to assemble!!! And very nice color. You will not be disappointed Thanks!! 5 stars......
customer_reviews.author: Poundy3

customer_reviews.title: Not the best bike.
customer_reviews.text: The price was too good to be true. I had bought the bike for my son's Birthday. It seemed like it was going to be a good bike but it did not last very long. The pedal on the right side broke off only after three rides. Also something was wrong with the brake lines. I would not recommend this bike to anyone. I also tried to contact Schwinn about getting the parts to fix the bike and I have not heard back from them. It's been very frustrating. Waste of time and money. Dont purchase!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Frame is to big and wedges the chain in b/w the front crank set and frame if the chain comes off.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bike for my daughter. After assembling the bike I attempted to put chain on front crank. This was not possible with out removing the front crank arms and internal bearings so I had enough room to dislodge chain. I didn't feel the need to have to do this on a new bike. It also damaged the paint trying to dislodge the chain. I ordered a replacement and this bike had the same issue. If this chain does ever come off when riding theres a high probability that the chain will get wedged b/w the frame and front crank. Very poor design I will not purchase again and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: Bike was delivered last week. It was pretty easy to complete the assembly and make adjustments, even though the manual was written for a hundred different models. I looked closely at all of the welds and they appeared to be complete and well made, so no worries there. All the component pieces like the seat, the brake assemblies, the handlebar clamps, etc. have a solid feel to them. Nothing wobbled or clanked when I rode it. For the money it's a great bike so far.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike. We bought it for family bike rides through cross town trails and it is perfect. It was relatively easy to assemble, although the actual directions were useless and/or misleading since the bike arrived in a more assembled state than what the directions assume. This is a fantastic bike, and we will buy another one so we have one for each adult.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M.

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive listing
customer_reviews.text: Well the bike seems good. No problems assembling. I work on cars but I think anyone could figure out the assembly, its pretty darn simple. The seat is very uncomftorable however. The listing clearly says in pictures of the exact bike that I got that its a 21 speed. This is not the case. The one I received is just a 7 speed. I think I'm happy with it but its awfully deceptive.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Roeder

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect out of the box, but mostly easy fixes
customer_reviews.text: Overall quite pleased. One star off for a slightly uncomfortable seat (but I’m a big guy with a stick butt, so grain of salt and all that) and shifter precision/function is still a work in progress adjustment wise. I’d say if you take the time to do proper adjustments on shifters and brakes, you will be happy with this bike. Also be sure to lubricate the front shocks - mine were a bit sticky during riding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Minor scratches and a missing part
customer_reviews.text: Well I got the bike today it had a few good scratches and was missing the front tire skewer, rendering the bike useless. Thanks to the local bike shop they had the parts I needed. I will probably never buy another bike from Amazon again and stick to the local shop with much better support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike. Surly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike in this price. Aluminum frame makes it really light weight with good strength. Good for road and trails. Front and rear disk break makes it easy to control on slippery road conditions. 27.5 inch wheels makes it a good riding machine. Would recommend it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Tanuj

customer_reviews.title: Great bike but..
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to work on doing some cardio. So I bought this bike. Took some time to assemble. Works good but the only complaint is that the bike seat is a little too small but other than that it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Vince H

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: We needed a bike for our 11 year olds birthday present. Finding a bike anywhere in this size right now is near to impossible. We found this on Amazon for $160 I was told it didn't have the hardware so I was prepared to purchase the hardware myself to put it together. However everything was included defintley a great buy very durable great for long rides on or off road.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: high quality bike
customer_reviews.text: Arrived earlier than initially expected! Easy to assemble. Brakes and gears were nicely pretuned. Had a test ride for about 2 hours. It runs very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Riding w/ comfort on Schwinn for a lily over $200.
customer_reviews.text: Putting the bike together.. I'm mechanically inclined,I mess everything up.. ;) Dont feel bad if this is you too.. Schwinn bicycle isn't as bad as others,word on the street.. Enjoy yr ride,ps,got a different seat from Schwinn,then the one that came w/,if you suffer from 'noassatall' might get something w/ more padding..
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Front Forks
customer_reviews.text: The bikes size is 27.5" and they sent me a 27.5" bile with a 26" front fork. The front tire rubs on the arch of the fork there for I cannot ride the bike. COntacted Schwinn and now have to wait for the right fork to be sent to me and it is on backorder. Waited 4 weeks for delivery and now it looks like it will take another 3-4 weeks for the new fork.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Best Bike For its Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike earlier this year and it was the best investment I made on a bike. This bike is super fast and the assembly was pretty easy. The gears on this bike change with no effort and the seat feels like sitting on a cloud. The brakes on this bike aren't tight and they make slowing down super easy. The bike is light and its super easy to get it on and off a bike rack. I haven't had to make any adjustments other than having to buy another type of water and phone holder but it was all worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dinesh

customer_reviews.title: Wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Love the bike. Only have to change seat for a gel / memory foam seat which makes a big difference. Overall all te bike is well built and handles better than expected. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Will2Power

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the aggravation
customer_reviews.text: After the delivery took almost a month (a super belated birthday present), the assembly was a NIGHTMARE! In addition there were missing parts for the tire. That was infuriating!
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Seat will not stay up, front tire rubs, missing nuts and bolts, no manual.
customer_reviews.text: It seems that bikes are best bought in person, (though that isn't always possible these days) this is the second time I have bought a bad bike from Amazon. I got it together with no manual supplied, but the front tire rubs, and the seat will not stay up. I would do not reccomend this bike.
customer_reviews.author: DDarko

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in poor condition
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bike for my daughter's birthday and as you can see from the pictures the end of the grip on the handle bar was smashed and looks like the installer put the brakes/shifter in without properly adjusting them - maybe this was for shipping. I am not sure if there is any QA but, if there is they need to make sure it's being done - it didn't happen on this order. I have a ordered a replacement and will edit this review when I get it.
customer_reviews.author: xtremeIX

customer_reviews.title: Failed back tire bearings and pedal stripped!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, you get what you pay for. I had to tune the bike pretty heavily to get it in working order. Messed with the brakes multiple times to make them stop rubbing. I had the left pedal strip off on a ride one day, it looks like it can slowly be loosened by simply riding it. Had trouble with the rear wheel having a slight wobble. Pulled the tire off the bike and it barely spins. I got the axle out and found that the ball bearings were all grinding and stuck trying to move past one another. It's been a mess since I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Corbin Turner

customer_reviews.title: Bent front tire and rim after two days of use...
customer_reviews.text: The bike is great but we had to replace the front tire and rim after two days of mild-use... The whole thing twisted up pretty badly... Had to go to a bike shop for the job which cost about half the value of the bike! Other than that, we are happy - just cost a lot more that we wanted to spend in the end and as the tire and rim had to be specially ordered, it was out of commission for a while...
customer_reviews.author: Carey D.

customer_reviews.title: piece of trash
customer_reviews.text: I assembled this bike and the second day i rode it , the handle binder bolt slipped and i slipped on the road riding this bike. spare your money of this piece of trash sold by amazon . Worst part is Amazon also doesnt care about the mishap i had. It wanted to compensate me with 5$ for my predicament. Spare your money of this product .
customer_reviews.author: Sid Mishra

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had nothing but problems since I got this bike!!! The breaks were sticking my first ride. They were stuck on so I was trying to ride with the breaks on! Then on my second ride the pedal completely fell off!!! I know what you’re thinking.... this chick probably did something wrong. Not the case! #1 my husband is a mechanic and #2 my neighbor is an avid rider so she knows a lot about bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Galvan

customer_reviews.title: The front fork was damaged when arrive (not aligned, so I can fit the front wheel)
customer_reviews.text: The product was delivered damaged (was not possible to see from the box). I called amazon. CS gave me all the options I have: - returning it. Unassembled everything and put on the box to return. - get it to a local shop to fix (they would reimburse it. So, if there is a problem, the problem is always yours. They won't help, they won't do anything other than accept the return.
customer_reviews.author: Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn 24 inch Mountain Bike - Silver
customer_reviews.text: The assembly would be hard if your not an experienced bicycle mechanic. I took it to a bicycle shop for assembly. On the great side, it is one top-notch mountain bike! Schwinn quality. It is a 24 inch mountain bike with a 7 speed Shimano shifter. It truly is a nice bike.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Gear and Chain Assembly lasted one week
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandson's birthday. First time on the road the front brakes needed adjustment. One week later the enter gear and chain assembly failed. Can not return it because while waiting the the big day the 30 day warranty expired. Schwinn does not appear to be the quality bike it was in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Fenn

customer_reviews.title: Never buy a bike online.
customer_reviews.text: Tires needed to be trued, had to replace the front tube. The last straw was the left pedal came off. Go to a bike shop for a bike.
customer_reviews.author: ZombieSlayer83

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The bike is a good value for the money. It was easy to assemble, the brakes take a little work. I’m 6’3, the 27.5/18 is too small for anyone over 6’0 unless you purchase a longer seat pole. I purchased a 17.5’ pole and it works fine. The bike rides well and the gears switch easy. I don’t ride far and I only on roads. I don’t know if the bike would hold up to a lot of trail riding.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm P

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn stands behind their product!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike that was easy to assemble. I had an issued with the front brake. I couldn't get it adjusted properly but I am not convinced there was something the matter with the brake or if I was doing something wrong. I contacted Schwinn and they send me a complete brake assembly with no questions asked. My daughter loves the bike and enjoys riding it. It is very well built. She is a smaller frame for an 8 year old girl but it fits her perfect and she can easily adjust the gears to adapt to any situation. Great job Schwinn.
customer_reviews.author: John Morris

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The bike itself has a nice look, however through riding less than 10 times in the 3 months I’ve owned it I’ve noticed a lot of issues which were not a huge deal. handlebars and seat often loosen up even after tightening which is an easy fix. However, yesterday mid ride the right pedal came completely off, once I attempted to reassemble I noticed that the area it would screw back into was completely stripped. It appears the same has begun with the other pedal as well. Do NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: 1st bike in 10 years and am pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Good base-model, adult mountain bike. Could be turned into a great bike with minor modifications like a more comfortable seat, included/ready-to-use stowage-rack, or better quality tires, but you cant expect those fine details without customizations. That said, i have had it several months and am pleased with it, but a big judgement point for a bike is how well it takes damage and standard wear and tear, which comes with more riding and more time. This isnt a long-term review.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This bike completely fell apart in 72 hours and 11 miles
customer_reviews.text: I initially rated this bike as crap because the directions i got arent even tailored for this bike. But it gets worse. These lazy people literally just put generic directions for all their bikes and they are terrible directions. But since getting this bike the handlebar has come off twice even though i was very careful to tighten it and both pedals are broken
customer_reviews.author: Christopher N.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first bike I’ve owned in 15 years. It basically comes all put together. Only had trouble with the front wheel but a quick google search of how to get around the rim brake. I’m 5’8 and it fits me well.
customer_reviews.author: James J

customer_reviews.title: Put together poorly
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this bike. Pedal stem threads stripped for no apparent reason. Schwinn was once a good bike, but now it is truly just a sad bike probably out of China. Junking in August 2019 due to bike falling apart piece by piece.
customer_reviews.author: Authur

customer_reviews.title: Everything was great....until it wasn’t.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot properly rate this bike yet. I opened the box and thoroughly separated the packaging and protective padding to begin assembly. After unpacking I discovered that I was missing both pedals and the quick release locking nut for the front wheel assembly. A call to the customer service number was cut short because they were not accepting calls. I don’t know if this review will yield a response or not. I will likely reach out to the manufacturer to request the parts that I need. We will see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not ok.
customer_reviews.text: Bike is ok for the money. I bought this bike as an entry level rider. 36 miles a week. Had to change out inner tubes front and back, cheap tubes from the factory. Parts wear out fast had to put it in the shop a few times. Had to send bike back in for warranty work on the frame. After 4 months of having it. Ride is good but would be better to spend a little more on a bike that is better made and parts are more durable . Bike is mediocre
customer_reviews.author: Josue

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: The bike was a pain to put together and it wouldn't adjust right so that the chain wouldn't rub on the derailleur. The front gear changer was too tight for me to change between all the gears. The seat was hard as a rock. Overall poor quality for the price especially being a Schwinn. Pretty disappointing. I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong solid nut front wheel arrived instead of quick release
customer_reviews.text: Excited to assemble and ride. Unfortunately, the front wheel was not a quick release. Instead if was a nut hub wheel. Spending hours with customer service to resolve to no avail... and no bike riding.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Smyth

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he loves it. We attached a toddler seat to the back of it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Regero

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, not quick release no bottle holder mount
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed, rear axle is not quick release. I never expected that. I thought all bikes use quick release. Now I'm going to have to see if I can take it to a bike store and swap out the axle. Also disappointed that doesn't have bottle holder screws. I'll have to use a clip/stap on bottle holder.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D. Vogin

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Bike arrived damaged and since it would’ve cost more to return, I just had it repaired at a local shop. Bike is good but having spent additional money, what I thought was a good buy turned out to be the opposite.
customer_reviews.author: cmk05

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first ride. No hassle replacement.
customer_reviews.text: The back tire bent on my sons first ride. Amazon picked up the broken one for free and a new one is on the way. Hoping it was just a fluke. Will return to update review if all is well with the replacement bike.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Good bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Opened box at the professional bike assembly shop with an employee only to discover no pedals and no guick release gear for the front (steering). How can I get Schwinn to send me these parts that were left out of my box?
customer_reviews.author: Boston Mom

customer_reviews.title: Rear wheel popping
customer_reviews.text: From day one when I got this bike the rear wheel was making a popping sound. I was able to diagnose this by taking a friends rear wheel and putting it on mine his worked. Because of Covid-19 there is a lack of bikes to buy or Exchange so I just bought another rim.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike
customer_reviews.text: Very easy assembly and works great even on rough terrain. The seat is a little uncomfortable as others have said though. It was very worth the money, and it the perfect size...I am 5'5"
customer_reviews.author: JessD

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: 24 Inch wheels, great for my 13 year old son. You must put it together. Not hard at all. Great. Got it for $325.
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Small bike. Seat post is wrong size. No easy instructions or the crucial Allen wrench included
customer_reviews.text: This bike is too small if you are over 5.5 feet tall. Also, wrong size seat post, defective. Need new seat. No customer support to try to fix error or to swap with a good non-defective seat. Also, not easy to put the bike together even though it came 80% preassembled. The crucial Allen wrench was not included. No easy instructions enclosed, so I had to google research how-to on my own. Headache.
customer_reviews.author: Maher

customer_reviews.title: Bent wheels!
customer_reviews.text: Bike looks great but when I put it together I realized both the front and the rear wheels were bent... waiting on a response from Amazon for a replacement that isn’t jacked up
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Bicycle chair is torn!
customer_reviews.text: I feel very disappointed since I received the bike chair torn as shown in the photo below. I expected that packaging will be better than this :(.
customer_reviews.author: One Family

customer_reviews.title: 24” Not big enough
customer_reviews.text: Bicycle is easy to ride and appears to be of good quality! However, I am 5 feet tall so I ordered the 24 in wheel. The description says the 24 inch wheel is good for a person up to 5’6” tall. I wish I would have ordered the 26 inch. The handle bars are too short and the seat is too.
customer_reviews.author: momwithkids

customer_reviews.title: Pedal gear parts were defective!
customer_reviews.text: Pedal gear part was defective. It was making a constant clicking sound with each cycle. I had to take it to a bike repair shop and had to pus $43 to get it replaced and fixed. You would be better off buying it from a store as you have to build it and get any parts fixed that are defective. Unless of course if you want to go thought he hassle of returning the entire bike and wait for another one...
customer_reviews.author: Deniz ergokcel

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Front Wheel Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to start assembling this nice looking bike. Unfortunately, the wheel assembly I received has few problems with it. The screw holes on the middle of the front wheel which the quick release lever suppose to go in is not hollow at one side. The lever suppose to go through from one side and exit from the other side. However, the one I have does not have a hole at the other side. I have emailed the customer service and have not received any HELP OR REPLY so far. Disappointing customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Gnofiep

customer_reviews.title: the pedals are mismatch
customer_reviews.text: the pair of pedals in the package has two different sizes, the left one can't install, can't contact the seller to replace, think about return the whole bike, or spend money to buy pedals for it.
customer_reviews.author: WSun

customer_reviews.title: Excellent except missing seat post bolt.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice bike, nice color and easy build. Though it was missing seat post bolt that required me to goto my local bike shop to complete.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Laucius

customer_reviews.title: Truing and adjustment needed,
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. After a month of use, the rear wheel needs truing. It's been difficult to get rid of a clanging sound when pedaling but it works ok.
customer_reviews.author: RArg

customer_reviews.title: Twisted tires
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the tires. I fixed it once after a week and now it's too late to send in and they are both twisting again. I would like a refund or another set of tires.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Amaya

customer_reviews.title: not a good design.
customer_reviews.text: slightly mad..the item i originally clicked on said aluminum frame..this isnt!..its a tank..and you cant turn with the 29s in such a short base frame...not a good design...ive always bought schwinn but this bike wont do what i want it to do being such a tank.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin E Deno

customer_reviews.title: Major upgrade from my 10 speed bike from the 80's
customer_reviews.text: Assembly wasn't the smoothest. Once I got it together, I realized that I should have upgraded years ago. Bought it to get exercise during the Covid lock down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check back tire before biking!
customer_reviews.text: The bike is good but when I went on my first long bike ride everything went great until I got back and had it sit over night and than I noticed the next day the back tire was flat. I took off the back tire and noticed the tube was pinched next to the value which cause the tube to get a small hole in it. Which was installed at the factory.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Schmiesing

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and well built
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble; took about half an hour to put together. Well built bike. Gears work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Amod B

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Came on time. Easy to put together. Very little assembly. Son is 10 and loves the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R. Casale

customer_reviews.title: Great bile
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the value. Easy to assemble. Rides great. Shifts great. Been riding it every night since I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great bike that is very easy to put together and so pretty.
customer_reviews.author: erin pruett

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I like it so far. The assembly instructions were relatively clear. One thing to note: make sure the bolt of top of the handle bar is very tight or the handle bar will disconnect from the fork and you will lose control. Size wise, I'm almost 5'7" and 30" inseam, and it feels a little too high for me. My inseam almost touches the top frame tube. I think a 17" or 16" bike would give me more clearance, but I'm happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: hyperwookiee

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The bike was extremely difficult to assemble and took 4 hours and lots of tweaking. The first time I rode the bike, the pedal twisted and broke off during the ride. I now have to find parts to fix the pedal or hope for warranty coverage. Very bummed! I was hoping to use this as a commuting bike but I feel unsafe now.
customer_reviews.author: Tucker Kaas

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner bike!
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner bike. I'm 5'5 and it's just the right height. One suggestion though is to have a professional look it over to make sure all connections are tight after you have it assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!!!! I’ve ridden my bike twice for a total of 25 miles and I have a loud knocking in the peddle mechanics. I bought Schwinn because of its reputation; however, this bike is junk!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Carter

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup. We'll see how it lasts over the long run but so far would recommend. This bike likely wouldn't be great for hardcore mountain biking but great for casual riding around town.
customer_reviews.author: YankeesPinstripes

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves this bike
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a bike for our nine year old daughter that wasn’t girly and pink and this was bike was perfect! Great quality bike that will grow with her as she gets older!
customer_reviews.author: Kerra W.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Was searching everywhere for a good bike at a good price. This is a great bike. Purchased for my 13 year old. Schwinn continues to be a great brand.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bike.
customer_reviews.text: Bike arrived packed well. Found assembly to be easy. When inflating front tire, i used small compressor. Aired to 20psi, then checked a 2nd time, showed 22psi. I continued inflating and almost as soon as air started going in the inter-tube exploded. Cheap inter-tubes. Very thin.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our sons 8th birthday and he LOVES it!!!! Doea look a bit smaller then I was expecting but it's been a great bike so far.
customer_reviews.author: Boymom3

customer_reviews.title: Cheap tires
customer_reviews.text: Tires leaking air on the first bike ride. I waited forever for this bike to arrive and after I filled it up with air I went on my first bike ride about five blocks I had to walk back home because the tires didn’t hold the air. The problem is not from the valve it’s leaking from the Rubber itself
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: The peddle just broke off. We have had it for 45 days. Can’t return it after 30 days. What kind of crap is that. I’ve had my other bike for 4 years and never had a peddle break off
customer_reviews.author: brittny godwin

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR TALL FOLKS
customer_reviews.text: Its misleading that its suits someone who is 6' 4" I put the saddle as high as it will go and I have to use my heels to peddle
customer_reviews.author: Donal Dowling

customer_reviews.title: Best Bike I ever purchased!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this bike! Even nicer in person, love the colors and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with product at the price it’s at
customer_reviews.text: Bought bike in June and the handle bars are stripped or aren’t gripping to frame so they spin when trying to turn. Maybe defective bike but shouldn’t be for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Therecreationalhippies

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. If you looking to buy your first bike and ride it in the neighborhood few miles a day nothing crazy this bike will do. Overall it’s not a bad bike.
customer_reviews.author: Oleg

customer_reviews.title: Gears and mounting bracket damaged
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift and it arrived damaged. The gear and mounting bracket were bent. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: I needed a decent bike!
customer_reviews.text: With all that's going on right now, this bike was truly a great comfort to have in order to stay in shape. It was easy to assemble and I was riding in minutes!
customer_reviews.author: poorestofboys

customer_reviews.title: My husband rode it and found it would do very nicely for rugged Northwoods trails
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson got this for his birthday. My husband rode it and found it would do very nicely for rugged Northwoods trails. So one has been ordered for grandpa!
customer_reviews.author: Flash

customer_reviews.title: Good looking bike, but had some issues with back wheel
customer_reviews.text: Good looking bike. Had to return it because the back wheel tire kept clipping the tube and cracking it It would not hold air more that 2 or 3 days without breaking . I liked the bike, but I think it mine may have been a lemon. Seat is a little hard. Overall, the few times I rode it when it was working it was fun.
customer_reviews.author: Erjon

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for our 13 year old son to trail ride. We have had the bike for a couple of weeks and have already had to replace parts on it. Would not purchase this one again and would not recommend if you plan to use this for anything more than easy road riding.
customer_reviews.author: RWMc

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: great bike I use it to give my son rides all over town. great value but just great period.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Cruz

product_meta.title: Schwinn High Timber Youth and Adult Mountain Bike, Aluminum and Steel Frame Options, 7-21 Speeds Options, 24-29-Inch Wheels, Multiple Colors
feature_bullets: Schwinn mountain frame with Schwinn suspension fork for controlled riding on tough trails
Shimano twist shifters with 21 speed rear derailleur for quick gear changes on the trail
All terrain, wide knobby mountain tires sit on light and durable alloy wheels for added stability

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
